lead_paragraph: The N.C.I.S. has begun further inquiry into allegations that Navy SEALs and Afghan police militiamen beat several detainees, including one who died, at an isolated outpost in 2012.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg and Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Navy to Revisit SEAL Conduct in Afghanistan
headline.main: Investigation of SEAL Conduct in Afghanistan Is Reopened

snippet: The N.C.I.S. has begun further inquiry into allegations that Navy SEALs and Afghan police militiamen beat several detainees, including one who died, at an isolated outpost in 2012.
abstract: Naval Criminal Investigative Service reopens its probe into alleged beatings of detainees by Navy SEALS and Afghan police at isolated outpost in Afghanistan in 2012; previous inquiry had ended after SEAL commander cleared members of wrongdoing, but revelations in New York Times article and questions from Congress have raised further concerns; latest investigation will seek out new Afghan witnesses.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
